question: A known alcoholic presents to to the emergency room with hematemesis. On examination he has ascites with splenomegaly and gynaecomastia Diagnosis is -
exp: Ans. is 'b' i.e., Portal hypertension due to Alcoholic cirrhosis o The patient clearly has portal hypertension due to alcoholic cirrhosis (Gynaecomastia indicates cirrhosis as a cause of portal hypertension).
opa: Portal hypertension secondary to viral hepatitis
opb: Portal hypertension due to Alcoholic cirrhosis
